I had dinner here 2 nights in a row when I stayed in Barcelona in June of 2014.  The food was awesome, the ambience was super cool and you can even write on a title on the wall to capture your experience in Barcelona!  I sat at the bar one night and the bartends made me amazing Spanish cocktails with Juniper berries and gave me a complimentary shot of a crazy aperitif with flames on the bottle that translated to "caution, fire".  The tuna was amazing and served in a cute tin and the dessert was incredible--corn ice cream drizzled with bourbon and, topped with bourbon covered caramelized popcorn and berries.This is a must when in Barcelona.  It is in a great neighborhood and walking distance to some of the best shopping, clubs and fanciest hotels in the city.
